required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Function and Quality of Life After Emergency vs Planned Creation of a Stoma
clinical_study.official_title: StomaFUNQ. Function and Quality of Life After Emergency vs Planned Creation of a Stoma

brief_summary.textblock: The aim is to answer is compare functional outcome and or quality of life in patients with a stoma that was constructed as an emergency procedure with patients where a stoma was created as a planned procedure. To do this data is retrieved from the Swedish Patient Register to identify all patients with a diagnosis of colorectal cancer and a stoma construction procedure during two previous calender years. To collect data on stoma function and quality of life a specific questionnaire will be sent to the cohort approximately within 2 years of the procedure.

primary_outcome.description: rate of patients who are satisfied with stoma function, rate of patients experiencing leakage from bandage, rate of patients who have needed more than three changes of type of bandage

secondary_outcome.description: question of experienced QoL last month with a Likert scale anchored by "worst possible" and b"best possible" respectively

other_outcome.description: cost of stoma bags, visits to stoma nurses, re-operations to improve stoma and/or reapir a parastomal hernia

arm_group.description: an emergency procedure including stoma construction, as first procedure at or shortly after diagnosis of colon or rectal cancer
a planned procedure including stoma construction, as first procedure after diagnosis of colon or rectal cancer

intervention.description: The difference between groups is the timing or type ie emergency as opposed to planned

study_pop.textblock: all registered individuals who had a primary surgical procedure including a stoma as treatemtn for colon or rectal cancer in Sweden in 2019 and 2020.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- stoma permanently or for shorter period
Exclusion Criteria:
- not understanding Swedish
